results.title: Heavy petting
results.brief_description: Using footage from Hollywood in the 50’s and 60’s and educational material from the era, known personalities reflect on what it was like to be a living, breathing, sexual being in the 1950’s or 60’s. People such as Allan Ginsberg, William Burroughs, Sandra Bernhard, Francis Fisher, Frederic Lahey, John Oates and Zoe Tamerlaine discuss issues such as; dating, masturbation, petting, falling in love, menstruation, things you did to look cool, cruising, parties, dances, teen pregnancy, STD, and all the other concerns surrounding being a teenager. Set to a soundtrack of music from the decades in question, this snappy and entertaining documentary presents the viewer with a slice of 50’s and 60’s nostalgia.

results.title: Heart attack
results.creator_credit: Imre Horvath and CBS News Production
results.brief_description: America’s number one killer is the heart attack and if you are going to have one, you’re better off having it in Seattle. This is the opening message of this film which shows that it is necessary to deal with a coronary in the first crucial moments.

results.title: Heard and not seen
results.creator_credit: A. Henley and Masters and Boys of Holloway School
results.brief_description: A boy sent out of art class for misbehaviour mixes a drink in the chemistry laboratory which makes him invisible. A series of amusing incidents ensue. Finally the effects wear off and he is caught in the headmaster’s office.

results.title: Hear no evil
results.creator_credit: Kate Hampel, Fiona Hergstrom and December Films
results.brief_description: Helena, manager of flamboyant suburban heavy metal “vampire” band Catwitch, has great expectations for their success. Her aspirations are hampered by the reality of organising a group of suburban boys. Through insight into family relationships and the everyday lives of band members and fans, we see how excessive music has a direct relationship to the suburban culture from which they come. A heady mix between heightened fantasy and suburban reality.

results.title: Health of a nation
results.brief_description: A survey of the measures carred out by the British Government to safeguard the people’s health: pre-natal clinics, maternity hospitals, child welfare centres, and school medical services help to ensure that the rising generation is healthy, but the importance of environment is not overlooked. Slums are being replaced by modern housing estates, and special measures are taken to combat industrial diseases which cause ill-health among industrial workers.
